property.name: Rules
property.value: You may discard a Plains card rather than pay this spell's mana cost. Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As war raged on, the young mages became more direct in their tactics, often at great cost.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kev Walker

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Jamuraa's rhystic mages treat magic as their garden, uprooting unwanted spells as bothersome weeds.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Rebecca Guay

property.name: Rules
property.value: If you have 3 or less life, this spell costs {6} less to cast. Flying Avatar of Hope can block any number of creatures.

property.name: Artist
property.value: rk post

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player's life total becomes 20.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The fourth wind of ascension is Anointer, deifying the worthy." - Keld Triumphant

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anthony S. Waters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Celestial Convergence enters the battlefield with seven omen counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ray Lago

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying, vigilance

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To outrace the griffin - Kipamu expression meaning "to do the impossible"

property.value: John Howe

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can block any number of creatures.

property.name: Flavor

property.value: D. Alexander Gregory

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile target attacking creature unless its controller pays {X}.

property.value: D. Alexander Gregory

property.name: Rules

property.value: Basic lands each player controls have shroud as long as that player controls three or fewer lands. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
